verse.roman:
carācaram idaṁ viśvaṁ
bhāvā ye cāsya hetavaḥ
mad-rūpāṇīti cetasy
ādhatte vipro mad-īkṣayā

synonyms: cara—moving; acaram—and nonmoving; idam—this; viśvam—universe; bhāvāḥ—elemental categories; ye—which; ca—and; asya—its; hetavaḥ—sources; mat—My; rūpāṇi—forms; iti—such a thought; cetasi—within his mind; ādhatte—maintains; vipraḥ—a brāhmaṇa; mat—of Me; īkṣayā—by his perception.
translation: Because he has realized Me, a brāhmaṇa is firmly fixed in the knowledge that everything moving and nonmoving in the universe, and also the primary elements of its creation, are all manifest forms expanded from Me.
